![](assets/img/lecture/John_Snow.jpg) ::: ::: ## Health Geography
::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="33%"} ::: {.color-box-light-blue .fragment fragment-index=1} **Environmental health**: focuses on environmental hazards, environmental risk assessment, and the physical and psycho-social health impacts of environmental contamination. ::: ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} ::: {.color-box-light-blue .fragment fragment-index=3} **Disease ecology**: study of infectious diseases (including NTDs) and the spatial distribution of environmental, social, political & economic conditions associated with disease. ::: ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} ::: {.color-box-light-blue .fragment fragment-index=2} **Health care delivery and access**: spatial patterns of health care provision and patient behavior. ::: ::: ::: ::: {.notes} Health geography is the application of geographical information, perspectives, and methods to the study of health, disease, and health care. Mencionar usos y aplicaciones del SR en los 3 campos ::: ## Health Geography
::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="33%"} ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} ::: {.color-box-light-magenta} **Disease ecology**: study of infectious diseases (including NTDs) and the spatial distribution of environmental, social, political & economic conditions associated with disease. ::: ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} ::: ::: ::: {.notes} While RS has applications in all fields, I'll focus on those related to disease ecology ::: ## Disease Ecology I ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="57%"}

![](assets/img/lecture/global_view_diseases.png){width="700"} ::: ::: {.column width="43%"} The main objective is to understand the influence of environmental factors and to predict when and where a disease is most likely to occur ::: {style="display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center;"} {{< fa solid angles-down size=2x >}} ::: decision making, planning of prevention, management or response actions, etc. ::: ::: ## Disease Ecology II ::: {.r-stack} ![Epidemiology triad](assets/img/lecture/disease_triad.jpg){.fragment width="150%" fig-align="center"} ![](assets/img/lecture/lambin_2010.png){.fragment width="85%" fig-align="center"} ::: {data-id="box" .fragment style="background: rgba(232, 31, 118, 0.2); border: 5px solid; border-color: #e81f76; width: 700px; height: 370px; transform: translate(0%, -26%);"} ::: ::: ## Remote sensing basic features ![](assets/img/lecture/all_resolutions_relation.png){fig-align="center"} ::: {.notes} What can we see with remote sensing to contribute to disease ecology? ::: ## Remote sensing & scale I

:::{.r-stack} ![General approach used in (disease) ecology](assets/img/lecture/workflow_sdm_other.png) ::: {data-id="box1" .fragment style="background: rgba(232, 31, 118, 0.2); border: 5px solid; border-color: #e81f76; width: 300px; height: 140px; transform: translate(-115%, -77%);"} ::: ::: {data-id="box2" .fragment style="background: rgba(232, 31, 118, 0.2); border: 5px solid; border-color: #e81f76; width: 300px; height: 160px; transform: translate(-115%, 30%);"} ::: ::: {data-id="box3" .fragment style="background: rgba(232, 31, 118, 0.2); border: 5px solid; border-color: #e81f76; width: 330px; height: 300px; transform: translate(100%, -10%);"} ::: ::: ::: {.notes} - To map the response variables, i.e., species occurrence or abundance, infections, disease cases - To map the predictor variables - To validate predictions ::: ## { background-image="assets/img/lecture/satellite_and_earth.jpg" } ::: { style="color: #ffffff; font-size: 1.5em;" } Let's have a look at some real cases... ::: --- ### Detecting and mapping species occurrences
- Very high resolution imagery - Hyperspectral data (esp. for plant species) ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="53%"} ![(a) Emperor penguins. (b) Elephants ](assets/img/lecture/map_spp_from_vhr_img.png) ::: ::: {.column width="47%"} ![Great gerbil burrows classification](assets/img/lecture/great_gerbil_burrows.jpg) ::: ::: --- ### Time series analysis of satellite products - MODIS LST temporal and spatial reconstruction - Estimation of relevant indices (GRASS GIS temporal framework!) - Detection of spatial and temporal clusters of favorable conditions for the occurrence of West Nile Fever cases in Greece ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="33%"} ![LST gap-filling process](assets/img/lecture/fig_modis_workflow.png) ![](assets/img/grass_gis.svg){.fragment .absolute top=350 left=-100 width="90"} ::: ::: {.column width="67%"}
![Co-cluster of derived LST indices](assets/img/lecture/co_cluster_method.png){.fragment .grow} ::: ::: ::: footer [Metz et al., 2017](https://https://www.mdpi.com/2072-4292/9/12/1333/htm), [Andreo et al., 2018](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8519542) ::: --- ### Environmental risk of Dengue - MODIS LST is used to estimate number of EIP, the higher this number, the higher the environmental risk ![[CONAE Geoportal](https://geoportal.conae.gov.ar/mapstore/#/viewer/openlayers/geoportal)](assets/img/lecture/riesgo_dengue_por_localidad.png) ::: footer [Porcasi et al., 2012](https://geospatialhealth.net/index.php/gh/article/view/120), ::: --- ### SDM & GIS based approach for HPS risk map ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](assets/img/lecture/workflow_sph_andreo_etal_2014.png)
![](assets/img/grass_gis.svg){width="30%" fig-align="center"} ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} We combined a rescaled probability map of the host with one of the human cases to determine levels of transmission risk ![](assets/img/lecture/riesgo_sph_andreo_etal_2014.png) ::: ::: ::: footer [Andreo et al., 2011](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10393-011-0719-5), [2014](https://www.mdpi.com/1999-4915/6/1/201/htm) ::: --- ### Cutaneous leishmaniasis and LULCC

Object-based classification of VHR imagery - Estimation of landscape metrics for polygons - Clustering analysis to find similar polygons - Stratified distribution of ovitraps ::: ::: {.column width="65%"} ![](assets/img/lecture/tesis_carla.png) ::: ::: --- ### Predictive system based on population dynamics and weather forecasting {.smaller} ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"} ![](assets/img/lecture/modelo_exe.png) ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ![](assets/img/lecture/Fig_agui.png) ::: ::: ::: footer [Aguirre et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ecoinf.2021.101351) ::: ## Other applications in the pipeline {.smaller} - Integrated surveillance system for vector-borne diseases based on spatial information (FMS, kan; BID funding). - Incidence of respiratory diseases as a function of remotely sensed air quality and LULCC (citizen science and web-based data mining) (PhD Thesis project Abraham Coiman - CONAE) - Distribution of mother-to-child transmission diseases and access to health in the triple border Argentina-Bolivia-Paraguay (Doctoral thesis project Carla Rodriguez Gonzalez - CONICET) ## Other applications in the pipeline {.smaller} - Comprehensive epidemiological characterisation of intestinal parasite infection in children in the Department of General Jos√© de San Mart√≠n, Salta (Doctoral thesis project Matias Scavuzzo - CONICET). - Geospatial modelling of malnutrition in children and adolescents in Argentina (Doctoral thesis project Micaela Campero - CONICET) - Environmental variables associated with non-communicable diseases (Postdoctoral fellow Juan Diego Pinotti) ## Gaps, opportunities and challenges ## Difficulties and challenges I - Compromise between different resolutions - VHR, LiDAR, UAV, Hyper-spectral (U$S) - Missing data, clouds, shadows (spatial and temporal interpolations) - Need for corrections of various types - Large volumes of data vs. bandwidth, storage and computational capacity (cloud computing, parallelisation, learning time and U$S) Field data will always be needed! :) ![](assets/img/lecture/satellite_b.png){.absolute top=100 right=5 width=150} ## Difficulties and challenges II - Updating and digitisation of disease cases and intervention data - Harmonisation of records at different levels and from different systems - Facilitating data access and public access to aggregated health data - Training of staff - Development of standardised, reproducible and scalable methods - Commitment and allocation of resources ## New missions ## UAVs ## Insaludables at Gulich Institute { background-color="#1A428A" } ![](assets/img/lecture/insaludables.png) # { background-image="assets/img/lecture/CONAE_aereo.png" } ::: {style="color: #6aaae4; font-size: 5em;" .fragment} Thanks! :::

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
